website_summaries.verdict: All metal design provides a contemporary look that's different from most media towers.
pros: Includes individual slots for each media case, which simplifies organization
Can be affixed to a wall or will work free-standing
Should last a long time with its all-metal construction
cons: Really only made for CD cases, and it only holds 80 of them

customer_reviews.title: The assemby prongs did not line up, leaving one out not fastened.
customer_reviews.text: The Cd's, as long as they are packages in a regular CD Jewel based box fit. But not well, and they stuck out and not very well flushed with the CD rack. CD's that were in a paper which could either be a special edition or just the way they were made (Digi-pak) DO not fit at all. A huge, gigantic buyer beware. IT is the last time I order without going to a brick and mortar store with CD's to see if they actually within in the device. My advice. Take it off the market. Not even going to send it back, not worth the effort. I'll take the hit.
customer_reviews.author: E. Adam Begens

customer_reviews.title: Not as bad as people say
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little sketchy like everyone says. But I’m an OCD Virgo and if I can live with it, you can too. Just add a weight in the back. I use my guitar case and it works fine. Just don’t put it in a high traffic area. I bought a used one and was slightly ticked off one of the slots was slightly bent probably due to the last idiot who got upset with it and repackaged it. Still not enough to lose sleep over. I’d say it was worth it. Buy new though if you’re gonna bother. Sometimes these sellers need to give more of a break in price for used I think, but that’s another story.
customer_reviews.author: Isabelle pierce

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It’s was kinda a pain to put together. But I’m easily agitated sometimes so no biggy put some of my cds in there now I have more space where my cds once sat. I’m glad this is a standing one you can also hang it on the wall option. Think hanging it is a bit of a pain cause you gotta find studs. But it’s a great looking cd rack and holds up to 80 cds which is cool cause it’s a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: iamrandomosity

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this stand.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. I plan to get more for my collection. So much better to have near than to clutter up your coffee-table or cabinet (my bookshelf was FULL of books). I HIGHLY recommend. I placed a half-brick at the back based on other's recommendations but somehow I didn't feel I needed that extra precaution. It stands up quite well I think by itself and isn't flimsy at all-for the money it is a very good buy. Came FAST and well boxed. Cd's are visible and handy yet look neat and it takes very little space. I LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT for DVDs
customer_reviews.text: Even though the style you select is for the amount for DVDs, it does not fit DVDs. Even thin blu-ray boxes get snug and you have to yank them out. Openings looked small when I took it out of the box but I gave it the benefit of the doubt and tried but only blu-rays could fit and it was a tight fit. I could not get regular DVD boxes to fit at all.
customer_reviews.author: FollyB

customer_reviews.title: Wasted My Money
customer_reviews.text: Trash - Do Not Buy I was impressed by other pictures showing this product used to organize DVDs & Blue Ray's so I thought it was worth the $35 to get the "80 DVD" rack but surprise it does NOT fit DVDs at all (only CDs fit) which is a joke because the buying option literally said "80 DVD" ... if you are trying to organize CDs then you'll love this but if you are like me and trying to organize your DVDs then don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Terrific for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Looks and works just like I'd hoped. The best part? It claimed little assembly... and thank you, the description spoke true! I'm an impatient moron when it comes to assembling things, and this was super-easy! Fits great in my room's corner; but it doesn't have to be corner-set to look good. Terrific for the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shari's Peculiar FascinationTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, broken, and and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This thing arrived all but demolished. A few of the wire rungs were broken and I had to bend the thing back to put it together. The box was in good shape so it was obviously put into the box broken. I'll be returning this thing asap
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The ad said no assembly required-----that is false! I had a heck of a time fitting the pieces together. It is functional, but ugly. Disappointed. Also it is wobbly. And the ad said it would hold 35 cd's....I was led to beleive that. Instead it holds 80 cd's----much more that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Worse item ever.
customer_reviews.text: Way to hard to get the 2 sectuons together. Not worth the trouble. Do your self a favor and look at a different type.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Does not go together easily. Still haven't gotten all 4 holes to line up with the top male part.
customer_reviews.text: Dislike the fact that the top half and the bottom half don't line up. Anyone out there, please tell me that there is an easy way to do it. Driving me crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Moriarty

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product
customer_reviews.text: The parts were not aligned properly and I had to take it to a hardware store and have them assemble it. I wanted to use it standing on the floor and it is so wobbly it has tipped over. I do not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Diane McGowan

customer_reviews.title: Complete my Library setup
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to place PS1 and Dreamcast game in it's own rack. Finally I came across this rack, and does the job perfectly. I could hang or use the stand. At this point I chosen to use the stand. This rack holds the jewel case securely.
customer_reviews.author: TBWELL

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot, and recommended except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy-duty product that has no trouble holding the advertised number of CDs. I have a fairly large collection of CDs, and I have filled up one 80-disk tower, so I ordered another one. This one works well and holds the CD securely. My only complaint is that one cannot push the tower back against the wall, and have the titles face directly outward. If you push the tower back against the wall, as I do, means the titles now face in an awkward angle. I suppose one cannot expect perfection, but I do wish the product could be redesigned so it could be right against the wall, and still display the titles straight out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott FS

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It simply won't stand up when fully loaded.... it falls forward under a full load of CD's... completely useless... I tried bending the metal frame and base and still too much weight to the front and falls forward....
customer_reviews.author: Barry Off Eastenders

customer_reviews.title: Good produce for whatever your needs.
customer_reviews.text: For me, it does just what I wanted. Granted, it can be little tippy when you go for a specific CD, but I happen to have it in a corner loaded with some specific ones I took out of my main storage spot (a big wooden thing that was getting far too full). I could probably nail it to a wall, but for now, it's working perfectly for my specific needs. In summary, it's a very well-made product.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Mccormick

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price.  Design needs some tweaks.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble for floor standing. At 4-feet it is a little taller than expected. Does seem to be a bit wobbly setting on hardwood floor. There is an option for wall mounting. CDs don't seem to go quite far enough into the slots. There is also not enough backward sloping angle to keep the CDs really secure. Does have 5 wider slots on bottom for double CD cases.
customer_reviews.author: R Lovec

customer_reviews.title: very nice & sturdy !
customer_reviews.text: it looks like nice & sturdy stand, it can just sit on the floor or be mounted to a wall. where i live, which is in a nursing home, i'll probably just sit it on the floor after i get the maintenance team to help me put it together !!!! i would definitely reccomend this to anyone who has alot of dvds or cds. it would defiinitly help in keeping them organized !
customer_reviews.author: glen pollard !

customer_reviews.title: Not for Dvd's and Games
customer_reviews.text: So it's not bad and assembly wasn't nearly as hard as some reviews make it out to be but be aware this listing has CD and DVD sized options and reviews jumbled together. Bought this stand specifically because so many reviews and pictures showed game and bluray/dvd cases. Stand is much too narrow and spaces to small for either. Disappointed and sending it back but not really a product fault.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly easy to assemble according to the assembler in chief but then he declined to put his cd collection into it so now it’s holding the 5 cds I have that still have jewel cases while his pile of cds still clutters up the joint. Men. Why do I bother.
customer_reviews.author: The Great Cornholio

customer_reviews.title: Its better than I first thought
customer_reviews.text: I like the color (black) and it is a nice thickness that has a nice appearance and seems strong. At first, I set the tower up on the base and then screwed it with long screws that did not go all the way into the wall. Turned out, I had done the connection between the base and tower wrong. I ordered a second one and when putting together, I realized my mistake. It is more stable than I thought. I will try it without attaching to wall. Would be a better product if it could be also stabilized by attaching to wall though.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzie

customer_reviews.title: Not robust, but it doesn't need to be
customer_reviews.text: A little flimsy, but it doesn't have to stand up to a hurricane. Not an elegant piece of furniture, but it will store a quantity of CDs, and it hasn't fallen over yet. If you have a lot of CDs you might need several of these, but they look OK to us.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Bertola

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the price. It is sturdy, I have it free standing against wall and have not had any problem of it tipping over like some reviewers have had. Only thing where it could be better if it had more slots for double cds
customer_reviews.author: Carl1203

customer_reviews.title: HOLES DO NOT ALIGN EASILY
customer_reviews.text: What should be a simple design turned in to a big hassle. The holes didn't align properly so that we had to use brute strength and ingenuity to get the two parts together. Otherwise, product is ok, but not worth the $31. My bad.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Suds

customer_reviews.title: Needs work
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great but they could have made the gaps a little bigger as it’s very hard to put in the PlayStation games in and take out.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Mew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this cd tower is the perfect fit and sits beside my tv. Thank you for making a great product. All of my cds, dvds fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Maranda Williams

customer_reviews.title: Poor Welds
customer_reviews.text: I originally mounted this on the floor stand but later decided to move it to the wall. When installing this to the wall one of the welds on the mounting bracket broke. Not having any welding equipment I was unable to repair it, even with epoxy. If the manufacturer would beef up their welds and bracket design I might provide a better rating. Overall it meets the needs of a floor standing tower, just be careful when mounting to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: LoneWolf_NW

customer_reviews.title: Attractive Functional Storage for CD's
customer_reviews.text: This item is great! Very sturdy and nice looking. Does not tip at all - even when it is full of CD's. No need to weigh it down in the back as others have suggested. CD titles face the front when the tower is placed and put together correctly. No problems with this item at all. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NYGirl2

customer_reviews.title: Built strong, all metal.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well built. Unfortunately, I have some CD/DVD cases that wont fit in the slots. Paper covers are no problem, and thin plastic cases are also, but I've got a lot of software cases that are just 1/8"-1/4" wider that won't fit. Those we're ones that came with the software from the software supplier. It's best to secure the unit to a wall, as it's easy to tap and have discs fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Ronald C. Moss

customer_reviews.title: but that just made for a tighter fit and it wont come apart as easy if it were easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Works well, although I did have a little difficulty assembling it, but that just made for a tighter fit and it wont come apart as easy if it were easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Slammer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I used it in my craft room. It is sturdy but light. Works great for my purpose. I would but it again if I ever need another one.
customer_reviews.author: swan

customer_reviews.title: nice space saving CD rack
customer_reviews.text: it seemed a bit flimsy but holding up nicely full with CDs
customer_reviews.author: Susanna S.

customer_reviews.title: CD 80 Storage Tower
customer_reviews.text: 80 CD Tower is ok, Unfortunately, I live in an apartment and have a carpeted floor so when you load up tower with all 80 of your cd's it leans over like the Leaning Tower of Piza because it becomes top-heavy. The tower has to be anchored in some way to an object such as a wall or other. But for the price it's a value.
customer_reviews.author: N'yuk N'yuk N'yuk

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I received the Atlantic Onyx 80 CD tower today.Only one problem.Ther tower pieces are vedy sturdybut it seems impossible to attach the stand.I took it back apart,and maybe I'll be able to find a way to put it all together.There are plenty of slots for my CDs.But I should have looked a little bit longer before I leaped!
customer_reviews.author: michael brown

customer_reviews.title: not a stand alone, needs to be bolted to the wall
customer_reviews.text: I like the clean straight lines of this product so I bought this one. I wanted to have a free standing tower but it is to light weight. The CD's slide around if you even touch one much less try to pick one out in the middle. SO......... I bolted it to the wall and all is well. I love it now. Clean lines and it works just fine. Just dont get this for a standing tower, you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Britton King

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a rack for backup CDs that would fit in a small space. I can hang it on the wall or stand it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn S. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: well made item
customer_reviews.text: ordered two of these. looks like it will work well. one of the packages however had two of one of the base parts instead of one front and one rear. Going to see if I can get this rectified.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES O. WHITE

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking case
customer_reviews.text: The CD case can be either floor standing or wall mounted. My choice was wall mounted due to space limitations. The only negative thing that I can say is that once the CDs are in the case, with have a tendency to move if bumped. This is a vey minor problem as they do not fall out but only shift position.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Burkey

customer_reviews.title: Not good on carpet
customer_reviews.text: Yes it was easy to put together but for the number of cd's it holds is 80 and it's not sturdy enough on carpet maybe on hard wood floor it would be much sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: DeEddra

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! WORKS GREAT! TOO MANY CD'S FOR ONE SO HAD TO BUY 2!
customer_reviews.author: Valarie

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.  It will fall over.
customer_reviews.text: This is a poor design. The base is not wide enough which makes the tower lean forward with you add a bunch of CDs. Also it is not safe with kids as it is too easy to pull over.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Can’t attach to wall unless get some kind of extension supports.
customer_reviews.text: Kinda strange that you offer support to wall, yet foot of frame doesn’t allow for putting close to a wall. Weird!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Morris

customer_reviews.title: nice looking storage tower
customer_reviews.text: This is a very spacious, nice looking storage tower. While it is designed to be free standing, it's not too stable; it sways a bit, and one has to be very careful loading it, or walking near it. It could topple over.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, easy to assemble, probably better on hard floors as they will stand up better than on carpet.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one thinking my cd's would fit in it - came to realize I have over 200 cd's so I bought 2 more. Love them, and they have space for my larger boxed-set cd's also. They also have hardware for hanging on a wall which I intend to use because we have carpet and I'm afraid the dogs will knock them over.
customer_reviews.author: Jennda

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly unless.
customer_reviews.text: Could not find it in any local shops. A little too wobbly on its own so I attached it to the wall with a cord and hook. A little difficult for a 90 year old to handle, but I did it.
customer_reviews.author: edahelen

customer_reviews.title: Top heavy on carpeting
customer_reviews.text: The tower is nice, but with the cd ‘ s in it, and on carpeting it is top heavy and falls foreward. Had to put a magazine under it until i made a block of wood a And painted it black and fastened it to the base
customer_reviews.author: Brenda w.

customer_reviews.title: DOES THE TRICK FOR HOLDING LOTS OF CDs
customer_reviews.text: This tower was much more slender than the picture showed but it does the trick. I have it in a corner of my room where I can lean it back slightly against the wall so it doesn't tip because I have it on a carpet. It mainly fits single CDs and not boxed sets. All in all I'm pleased. It's a good solid metal material.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Parts must be perfectly aligned for assembly
customer_reviews.text: It was a hassle to assemble but it’s a handy way to store cds.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Hey, nice rack!!!
customer_reviews.text: A litte "tippy" when fully loaded, but a 5# dumbbell weight placed on the rear foot solved the issue. Considering a 2nd rack - very discrete looking.
customer_reviews.author: Snowbound

customer_reviews.title: Double album capacity
customer_reviews.text: I liked how many slots there are for double albums
customer_reviews.author: Diane Justice

customer_reviews.title: 80 CD tower owner
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying the Atlantic Onyx 80 CD tower because it puts all my CD's in one place and at my fingertips. I did have a problem though getting it to sit properly on carpet. It seems to be top heavy but I solved the problem by placing some heavy items on the back of the stand and it is working great. It would probably be okay on a hard floor and not on carpet and even better by mounting it on the wall. Where I have it located, I did not have the area where I could hang it on the wall. I would recommend this to anyone who needs their CD's organized.
customer_reviews.author: K. Earl

customer_reviews.title: It works kinda
customer_reviews.text: It holds cds but its really wobbly it'll work for now until i get something better
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This cd holder surprised me as to how sturdy ot is. I filled it up and it held great.
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sets. They are easy to mount on the wall. Having the CDs arranged horizontally makes it much easier to read the titles and artists.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Atlantic Onyx Wire CD Tower - 80 CDs
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, sturdy and well engineered stand. Holds CDs securely. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Olugbenga Kayode

customer_reviews.title: Not for PS4 or Xbox games!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This will not hold PS4 or Xbox games even when people have said it will. I bought this because I seen people said it would hold the games & it won’t unless you wanna break your gaming cases.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Atlantic Onyx Wire CD Tower
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Just do not know if it will stay up when it is filled.
customer_reviews.author: Kristan O. Helms

customer_reviews.title: Not what I originally wanted
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to buy a 80 dvd stand instead I got a 80cd stand. Not very happy but I did find some one who could use it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Great CD rack. Either stands or can be mounted on the wall. We chose to mount ours in the man cave
customer_reviews.author: Loni K.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot easily be attached to wall
customer_reviews.text: The tower works well and looks good but because of the shape of the triangular base it cannot be moved close enough to the wall to be attached with the screws provided.
customer_reviews.author: Renate E. Kosinski

customer_reviews.title: I really like the fact that when I pull out a CD ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fact that when I pull out a CD that it has a open space to put it back in to. Keeps them organized.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Below Expectation!!
customer_reviews.text: Could not use this product as the CDs could not fit with the side frames. Disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It holds our cd's O.K.
customer_reviews.text: ....but the base could be a little larger to improve stability. The tall version tends to move and cause the CD's to fall out if you bump it. It's best if mounted to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: scd

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The two rack sections were not aligned correctly so you could only secure 3 of the 4 prongs in the holes to lock the tower together. It was not worth the effort to re-package and return. If you are lucky enough to get one that fits properly the rack is very attractive and does not take up much space. Good fit for a corner wall.
customer_reviews.author: Ethel McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to attach the base, and so far I have not managed to connect the two sections. Good news that the metal doesn't bend, but a problem when the parts don't line up accurately. Suggestions welcome!
customer_reviews.author: JB Catlover

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy, but if looking for cheap, space-saving storage, not a bad option.
customer_reviews.author: I.Z. Conn

customer_reviews.title: leans forwrd
customer_reviews.text: fully loaded, the stand leans forward a little, CD's still stay put
customer_reviews.author: Jason Newman

customer_reviews.title: Assemble
customer_reviews.text: FYI: Whatever I tried the one connection would not line up or even bend to fit between C and D off by 1 cm
customer_reviews.author: Trudy J Rudnick

customer_reviews.title: Meets the need.
customer_reviews.text: Serviceable stand that meets my need. Stand tends to lean forward if not perfectly assembled. Lightweight so be careful with placement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Found this tower can tip over very easily, I keep a big rock on the backside of the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: fit together good
customer_reviews.text: it went together like it should, that was best part of it. does the job its spose to
customer_reviews.author: walker    Egge

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Horrible design. Will not stand straight with CDs in it. Falls over
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and it's a color that goes with everything. It wobbles a bit, but that's to be expected with the amount of cds it can hold. Would buy again if I needed another.
customer_reviews.author: mikoyoukai

customer_reviews.title: Too Unstable
customer_reviews.text: This rack is not stable, it can be easily knocked over if someone brush up against it.
customer_reviews.author: George Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: quality and designs meet my expectation,the price is okey plus the mailing time arrive earlier
customer_reviews.author: antonio robles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice; not that tipsy if placed on a hard surface.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: nice but could be sturdier
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 5 of these and wall mounted all of them, they hold up well and look nice , where they fit together though they could be tighter . Overall though I am pleased and will buy again
customer_reviews.author: locard16309

customer_reviews.title: Better than the previous version
customer_reviews.text: I already have an exact same CD tower as this one. The one I bought stands straight up when mounted, compared to the one I've owned for years, which is slightly slanted.
customer_reviews.author: Dhani S.

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: It’s holds all of our video games and movies, it’s not as sturdy as you would think.
customer_reviews.author: Piper

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together but be careful of placement
customer_reviews.text: Could be a little more stable. Tends to wooble if not positioned in a particular way.
customer_reviews.author: scott brady

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hold my cd”s. It serves it’s purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two towers and assembly took 7 minutes total. The workmanship is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly - hold my old CD’s which don’t get a lot of use
customer_reviews.author: Rich B

customer_reviews.title: The packing sucks
customer_reviews.text: The black wire CD is fine, not much can be wrong with the item; however, the packing was so excessive as to be almost obscene. The item came in its own factory provided light cardboard packing container. This container was then put "Diagonally" in a carton with about 10 inches of "headroom" and covered with 35 air filled plastic buffers to take up the wasted space inside the carton. A total waste of packing material!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something that would fit in my small apartment. It fit perfectly in the space that I had planned.
customer_reviews.author: midge

customer_reviews.title: It was what I expected. Came on time.
customer_reviews.text: I have it between a tall wooden file cabinet and a desk. It might have fall over otherwise. It looks good the way it is positioned.
customer_reviews.author: BJC

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: I ahve used a smaller version which fills up to fast. This is great and easy to put in a corner for display
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I had to return due to my error in ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Major

customer_reviews.title: Great CD Stand!
customer_reviews.text: If you are the type of person that like tower CD stands that let's you read the side labels of your CDs, then this is the item for you! Easy to put together; it can either go on your wall or on the floor, or both for more stability. I would recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: fits perfect on a little space on my wall and organizes my cds
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a gift for my mom and she really liked it. Now she has storage for her building stock of CDs.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Holder
customer_reviews.text: I decided not to put the bottom stand on it. Instead I screwed it to the wall. It holds 80 CD'S perfectly. It's well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Little Miss Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Nice CD Racks
customer_reviews.text: They work well screwed to the wall, which is what I got them for. I reckon they would be a bit wobbly if they were used free standing due to their height.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Gregory

customer_reviews.title: nice tower
customer_reviews.text: this was exactly what i needed at a fair price; great value!! holds double the slim jewel cases. love it
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: hang on the wall
customer_reviews.text: It tips over too easily so hang it on the wall
customer_reviews.author: dvo

customer_reviews.title: Low Cost CD Storage
customer_reviews.text: This Atlantic Onyx 1248 80 CD Tower is an inexpensive, space saving way to store your CDs. You could buy one of those fancy cabinets for your CDs, but if you want to save money and space this CD tower is the answer. The construction is sturdy. Also you can mount it on a wall or leave it free standing.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: BAD FOR PRICE
customer_reviews.text: THIS STAND FELL OVER SOON AS I HAD 25 CD'S LOADED. NOT A BIG ENOUGH BASE TO HOLD STAND UP
customer_reviews.author: BOWLER

customer_reviews.title: Tips over easily, if not secured to wall
customer_reviews.text: Tips over easily, if not secured to wall. But it holds 80 CD's and I've figured out a way to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: Rickety
customer_reviews.text: Does not stand on its own. It is designed so that you can fasten it to the wall, but if you do, then it is leaning at a slightly odd angle. It works. It holds CD's. But it is not ideal. Also, it is made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hellam

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver for a small apartment
customer_reviews.text: Great space saver for a small apartment. Hung it on a few nails in my closet and maximized that area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Atlantic Onyx Wire CD Tower - Holds 80 CDs in Matte Black Steel, PN 1248
product_meta.description:
Attractive Modern Design Black in color Highlights Any Home Entertainment or Office decor Efficient Space-Saving Design Provides Maximum Storage in a Minimum Amount of Space Flexible Usage to Meet All Your Needs - Can be Wall Mounted or Freestanding Heavy Gauge Steel Construction for Years of Use Ready to Use in Minutes - No Tool Assembly Required! CD Capacity 80 Unit Dimensions: (in inches) Length: 12. 88" Left To Right Measurement Width: 11. 00" Front To Back Measurement Height: 48. 50" Bottom To Top Measurement Weight: 6. 40 lbs

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



MAKE ATLANTIC'S "ONYX 80 CD TOWER" THE BASE OF YOUR CD COLLECTION


 Atlantic’s ONYX 80 CD TOWER sports an attractive, modern design to highlight almost any home or office décor. Its efficient, space-saving design provides maximum CD storage in a minimal amount of space. The durable steel construction will keep for years of use, yet provides a compact and lightweight frame for easy transportation. ONYX 80 CD TOWER can be used freestanding as well as wall mounted, and comes ready to use - No Assembly Required!

25 YEARS EXPERIENCE
Atlantic has been a leader in media & entertainment storage furnishings for over 25-years and we think it shows in the quality, value, and innovation of every product we produce - the ONYX 80 CD TOWER being no exception.

AT A GLANCE
Disc capacity: 80 CDs Space-saving design Durable steel construction for years of use No assembly required Wall mountable Compact and lightweight frame for easy transportation



 *** NOTE: COMPACT DISCS AND CASES NOT INCLUDED.
